problem_text:
Let R be the normal closure of an element r in a free group F with the natural
length function and suppose that s is an element of minimal length in R. Is it true
that s is conjugate to one of the following elements: r, r−1, [r, f], [r−1, f] for some
f ∈F?
V. N. Remeslennikov
answer: No, not always (J. McCool, Glasgow Math. J., 43, no. 1 (2001), 123–124).
